titles.title: Digimon Xros Wars: Aku no Death General to Nanatsu no Oukoku
Digimon Xros Wars: The Evil Death Generals and the Seven Kingdoms
Digimon Xros Wars II
digimon7
digixw2
デジモンクロスウォーズ ~悪のデスジェネラルと七つの王国~
Digimon Fusion II
数码宝贝合体战争 ～邪恶的死亡指挥官与七个王国～

relatedanime.anime: Digimon Xros Wars: Toki o Kakeru Shounen Hunter-tachi

recommendations.recommendation:
Another awesome action packed digimon series for fans!!!!
Join Taiki, Nene, Kiriha and their digimon on an epic adventure to defeat baguramon!!!

anime.description: Returning to the Digital World, http://anidb.net/ch17981 [Taiki] and http://anidb.net/ch17974 [Shoutmon] learn that the Bagra Army has taken it over and reformatted the world to have Seven Kingdoms, each ruled by a general.

externalentity.identifier: デジモンクロスウォーズ

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: virtual world
tag.description: A virtual world is a place where the character interacts with a computer (or some other device)-simulated environment, be it real or imagined. The condition for a virtual reality to exist is the existence of an originating "real" (source/anchor) world for the character. In some cases, a virtual reality where characters can get harmed physically is depicted.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: Greek mythology
tag.description: The anime is derived or draws elements from the Greek mythology, and as such features some mythological characteristics of Ancient Greece. Those may be creatures, such as the Centaur or Hydra, tales, such as that of the Trojan War, or even the Gods themselves, like Zeus or Poseidon. More subtle references also count, such as the careful usage of names of places or people that hold significance in the myths.

tag.name: catchphrase
tag.description: A catchphrase is a sound, word or phrase commonly used by a person. That may be simply out of habit, or in an attempt to deliver some form of image, like that of cuteness. In fiction, characters often use catchphrases as a way to deliver specific personality traits. Examples include Otohime Mutsumi`s "ara ara" in Love Hina, Yang Wenli`s "yare yare" in Legend of the Galactic Heroes, Misuzu`s "gao" in AIR, Sakura`s "hoe" in Card Captor Sakura, Suiseiseki`s "desu" in Rozen Maiden, and Ayu`s "uguu" in Kanon (as well as several other characters in the same show).

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Amano Nene
character.description: Cute brown hair ponytail girl. Her partner was Solarmon.

episode.title: 新たなる世界へ! 火烈将軍のドラゴンランド
To a New World! The Fire-fury General`s Dragon Land
Arata Naru Sekai e! Hiretsu Shougun no Dragon Land
episode.summary: Taiki and Shoutmon return to the Digital World to find it conquered by the Bagra Army. The Zones have disappeared and the world, under Bagramon`s reign, has been reformatted into seven Kingdoms ruled by seven Death Generals. Taiki and Shoutmon arrive in Dragon Land, a Kingdom full of the Bagra Army`s most powerful soldiers. But for some reason, when the enemy surrounds them, Shoutmon is unable to Digivolve to OmegaShoutmon. Then they witness the arrival of Kiriha, who has been seeking the Death General of this Kingdom, Dorbickmon... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 立ち上がれキリハ! クロスハート奪回作戦
Stand up, Kiriha! The Xros Heart Rescue Strategy
Tachiagare Kiriha! Xros Heart Dakkai Sakusen
episode.summary: Taiki and Shoutmon are overpowered by Dorbickmon, the Death General of the first Kingdom, Dragon Land. They`re in a tight spot when a mysterious flower girl Digimon appears and defeats Dorbickmon; she turns out to be Nene, who has learned that a certain pollen is the weakness of dragon Digimon. They all escape, but then learn that Dorbickmon plans to execute all the Xros Heart Digimon. Kiriha must stand up to save the team from a life-or-death situation - and reclaim his own pride! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 笑う狩人! 木精将軍ザミエールモン
Laughing Hunter! The Wood-spirit General Zamielmon
Warau Kariudo! Mokusei Shougun Zamielmon
episode.summary: Mervamon`s brother, Ignitemon, returns to the side of justice and joins Taiki`s team in the fight against Zamielmon. He reveals to Taiki that the secret to Zamielmon`s small, elusive size is DigiHoney, the power he steals from other Digimon. They then receive an invitation from Zamielmon to a theme park called Honey Park, and though they know it`s a trap, they go there with a plan to make Zamielmon bigger so they can fight him. However, Zamielmon grows much bigger than Taiki expected, and Xros Heart must send Shoutmon DX to face his giant new form! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パワーが吸われる! ハニーランドの狩人たち
Power is Getting Sucked Out! The Hunters of Honey Land
Power ga Suwareru! Honey Land no Kariudo-tachi
episode.summary: Taiki`s team arrives in the flower-filled third Kingdom, Honey Land, where they encounter some Digimon stumbling around listlessly. Then they find Lilamon being stung by Honeybeemon to drain her power. They try to save her, but Xros Heart`s Digimon are paralyzed by the attack of Ignitemon, a servant of the Death General Zamielmon. He begins to steal their power as well when a woman warrior Digimon, Mervamon, appears. Mervamon saves Taiki`s team and leads them in an attack on Zamielmon - but in the scrap, Ignitemon reveals that Mervamon is his older sister! Can Taiki`s team save the siblings from a heartbreaking battle? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死ぬなグレイモン! シャウトモンDX(ディークロス)誕生
Don`t Die, Greymon! Shoutmon DX is Born
Shinuna Greymon! Shoutmon D Cross Tanjou
episode.summary: NeoVamdemon`s forced DigiXros with MetalGreymon has made him much stronger. Taiki`s team searches for the legendary White Lopmon that holds the key to defeating NeoVamdemon, but when they can`t find it, Shoutmon lets himself be absorbed by NeoVamdemon to rescue MetalGreymon - and Lopmon follows him to save his own companions. Can their life-or-death efforts save MetalGreymon and defeat NeoVamdemon once and for all?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 背筋ゾワゾワ! 月光将軍のヴァンパイアランド
Shivers Down the Spine! The Moonlight General`s Vampire Land
Sesuji Zowazowa! Gekkou Shougun no Vampire Land
episode.summary: Taiki and his companions arrive in Vampire Land, a dark, eerie Kingdom ruled by the Death General NeoVamdemon. There they encounter Lopmon, who tells them that NeoVamdemon`s minions have been capturing other Lopmon when they Digivolve from Chocomon. Taiki`s team sets off for NeoVamdemon`s castle to free all the Lopmon, but they struggle through battles with immortal enemies and eventually Taiki`s Xros Loader is stolen. Then NeoVamdemon powers up by absorbing his own minions - and then he absorbs MetalGreymon as well! Can Taiki and his teammates overcome this crisis?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 強き愛を! デッカードラモン最期の叫び!!
A Mighty Love! Deckerdramon`s Last Cry!!
Tsuyoki Ai o! Deckerdramon Saigo no Sakebi!!
episode.summary: Instigated by the Death General of Canyon Land, Gravimon, Kiriha resolves to defeat Taiki in order to obtain ultimate strength. Taiki is forced to fight back, sending OmegaShoutmon against Kiriha`s ZekeGreymon. However, both Digivolutions wear off before a winner is decided. Kiriha sends his guardian deity, Deckerdramon, to finish off Shoutmon, but Deckerdramon defies his order and attempts to remind him of the importance of love... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キリハにささやく! 峡谷の土神(どしん)将軍, 魔の誘い
Whispers to Kiriha! The Canyon Earth Spirit General`s Devilish Offer
Kiriha ni Sasayaku! Kyoukoku no Doshin Shougun, Ma no Sasoi
episode.summary: Taiki`s party arrives in the sixth Kingdom, Canyon Land, where the Death General Gravimon commands a massive army. Kiriha takes charge as the team plans their battle strategy, and the others follow his lead... but Gravimon sees through their surprise attack and backs them into a corner. He perceives that something in Kiriha`s past drives his desire to be the strongest, and tells him that he can do so by defeating Taiki himself. How will Kiriha respond to Gravimon`s temptation? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 金賊(きんぞく)のオレーグモンが笑う! さらばクロスハート!
Olegmon the Golden Thief Laughs! Farewell Xros Heart!
Kinzoku no Olegmon ga Warau! Saraba Xros Heart!
episode.summary: The Death General Olegmon`s crew has turned Ballistamon into the ultimate destructive weapon, DarkVolumon! Olegmon uses him to attack and capture Taiki, whom he again invites to join his army. But when Taiki refuses, Olegmon orders DarkVolumon to attack Nene! Kiriha and Shoutmon soon arrive to save them, and Shoutmon attempts to restore DarkVolumon to his old self by calling out to Ballistamon through a DigiXros. Will his voice reach Ballistamon?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 陽気な海賊, 現る! ゴールドランドの航海!!
Arrival of the Merry Pirate! Set Sail for Gold Land!
Youkina Kaizoku, Arawaru! Gold Land no Koukai!
episode.summary: Taiki and his friends land in the golden sea of Gold Land, where they encounter the Death General Olegmon, riding on a pirate ship. Olegmon has heard of their battles with the previous Death Generals and invites them to join his crew, but Taiki refuses and the battle begins. However, Olegmon begins to chant a strange incantation, and nearly all of Xros Heart`s Digimon hear it and join Olegmon`s army! Ballistamon, who was unaffected by the incantation, rescues Shoutmon from the enemy`s grasp. They set out to defeat Olegmon together, but then an unexpected change happens in Ballistamon... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロスハート分裂の危機! 水虎(すいこ)将軍の卑劣なワナ
Xros Heart Break up Crisis! Water Tiger General`s Despicable Trap
Cross Heart Bunretsu no Kiki! Suiko Shougun no Hiretsuna Wana
episode.summary: Taiki and his team have been attacked by Dorulumon, who turns out to be the Death General Splashmon in disguise. A rift begins to form between Taiki and his friends as Splashmon continues to trick them one by one with his disguises. Cutemon and Revolmon find where the real Dorulumon is imprisoned and save him, but how can Xros Heart fight back against the powerful Splashmon?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謎のサイバーランド! 鋼の街の美少女
The Mysterious Cyber Land! The Beauty of Fullmetal City
Nazo no Cyber Land! Hagane no Machi no Bishoujo
episode.summary: Taiki`s team arrives in the fourth Kingdom, Cyber Land, a futuristic metal city wrapped in overwhelming silence. When a mechanical Whamon in the sky teleports a mechanical Andromon army from its mouth to attack them, the team dives inside the Whamon to destroy it. There they find a human girl named Ruka who says she was lost and the Bagra army captured her. Dorulumon is suspicious, but Taiki welcomes her into the team... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 弟よ, なぜ!? 敵ジェネラル・ユウの悪夢
Brother, Why!? The Nightmarish Enemy, General Yuu
Otouto yo, Naze!? Teki General Yuu no Akamu
episode.summary: When Kiriha says he saw a boy in Honey Land who fits the description of Nene`s brother, Nene is at last reunited with Yuu. However, Yuu thinks that battles in the Digital World are just a game, and attempts to finish off his sister! The battle between Taiki and Yuu begins after the team saves Nene, but Shoutmon X4B and MetalGreymon are no match for Yuu`s DigiXros, MusoKnightmon... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: きずなのX7(クロスセブン)! グラビモンとの壮絶バトル!!
X7 of Bonds! The Grand Battle with Gravimon!!
Kizuna no X7! Gravimon to no Souzetsu Battle!!
episode.summary: Taiki, Nene, and Kiriha are once again bound tightly by their strong friendship, giving rise to Shoutmon X7! With his ultimate attack, Shoutmon X7 at last defeats Gravimon... but he is reborn again thanks to a "heart" hidden somewhere in his castle. As long as his heart survives, Gravimon can come back to life infinitely. So Nene slips into the castle to destroy the heart while Taiki and Kiriha engage Gravimon in battle to draw him away from her search. Taiki attacks with a new seven-way Xros based upon Cutemon... but can they hold Gravimon off long enough for Nene to find his heart?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タイキVSユウ, 少年ジェネラル対決!!
Taiki VS Yuu, the Battle of the Boy Generals!!
Taiki VS Yuu, Shounen General Taiketsu!!
episode.summary: The big showdown between Taiki and Yuu has begun in Hell`s Field. Yuu attacks with a sword, overwhelming Taiki with his surprising strength. As they battle, Yuu confesses his reason for hiding his true strength all along, and reveals the words of DarkKnightmon that freed him when he came to the Digital World. Finally Taiki sees Yuu`s true nature and vows to fight him in earnest. Can Taiki defeat Yuu and make him see the truth?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 生か死か, 地獄のジェネラル決戦!
Life or Death, The Showdown with Hell`s General!
Sei ka Shi ka, Jigoku no General Kessen!
episode.summary: Yuu has thrown Taiki and his friends into a dark realm called Hell`s Field. Inside a castle they find a crystal that allows them to speak with Yuu, who tells them that his army has taken up camp in a castle opposite the one that Xros Heart has found. He then invites Taiki to play a game in which they each lead their armies against the opposing castle, and whichever one dies is the loser. Yuu still believes the Digital World is a game in which nobody really dies, so Kiriha comes up with a strategy to convince him that he`s wrong. Will Kiriha`s strategy succeed in showing Yuu the truth?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後の王国, 輝く太陽のブライトランド
The Final Kingdom, The Shining Sun`s Bright Land!
Saigo no Oukoku, Kagayaku Taiyou no Bright Land
episode.summary: Taiki`s team arrives in the seventh and final Kingdom, Bright Land, where the Death General Apollomon asks them to help him defeat Bagramon. Just when Kiriha and Nene are convinced to trust him as Taiki does, Yuu and Tuwarmon appear and activate a dark program called Whispered, which Bagramon had embedded in Apollomon. To defeat Whispered means to defeat Apollomon... Can Taiki find the resolve to fight their new friend?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デジタルワールドの未来のために! デスジェネラルとの友情!
For the Digital World`s Future! Friendship with Death Generals!
Digital World no Mirai no Tame ni! Death General to no Yuujou!
episode.summary: Taiki gets his own soul sent to Prison Land to bring back the souls of Shoutmon, Dorulumon, and Ballistamon. Soon he finds himself under the attack of the souls of the seven Death Generals, who overwhelm Taiki`s Digimon in power. Taiki is in a tight spot... when Olegmon realizes that the Death Generals are not his true friends and, along with the just Apollomon, joins Taiki`s side! Does Taiki stand a chance against the other five Death Generals with their help?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: よみがえる! 七人のデスジェネラル総登場!!
Resurrect! The Arrival of All Seven Death Generals!!
Yomigaeru! Shichinin no Death General Soutoujou!!
episode.summary: After defeating all seven Death Generals, Taiki and his friends reach the Great Bagra Palace. If they can defeat the Emperor Bagramon there, the Digital World will be reborn, and they can resurrect their fallen companions. But instead they`re greeted by DarkKnightmon, who uses the power of the Dark Stone to resurrect all the Death Generals. With their souls taken away, they attack Taiki`s team like robots... until DarkKnightmon forces all seven of them to DigiXros into the ultimate god of destruction! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タイキの決断! 最強のアポロモンを超えろ!
Taiki`s Determination! Overcome the Strongest Apollomon!
Taiki no Ketsudan! Saikyou no Apollomon o Koero!
episode.summary: Beelzebumon`s sacrifice has allowed everyone to escape Hell`s Field and return to Bright Land. But Apollomon Whispered has also returned, and is preparing to wipe out all of the Kingdom`s Digimon. When Taiki pursues him, Whispered assumes the form of Apollomon to weaken Taiki`s resolve to fight. Has Whispered won, or can Taiki find the strength and courage to fight his friend?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ベルゼブモン, 光に消ゆ!
Beelzebumon, Vanish into the Light!
Beelzebumon, Hikari ni Kiyu!
episode.summary: Yuu has run away after learning that there is no world without pain and suffering. As Taiki`s team tries to find him and get everyone out of Hell`s Field, Apollomon Whispered merges Lilithmon and Blastmon into a monstrous new Lilithmon bent on revenge! Meanwhile, Wisemon devises a false program to let everyone escape Hell`s Field without forcing Taiki or Yuu to die. But Shoutmon X7 must protect the castles while the program is activated, leaving him unable to fight. So the injured Beelzebumon sets off to stop Lilithmon himself... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バグラ兄弟, 暗黒の絆!
Bagra Brothers! The Bonds of Darkness
Bagra Kyoudai, Ankoku no Kizuna!
episode.summary: Xros Heart heads for the Great Bagra Palace to rescue Yuu and reclaim the Code Crown, which Bagramon and DarkKnightmon have transformed to the Dark Stone. When they arrive, Bagramon proceeds with his plan to activate D5, the Day of Ultimate Destruction, which will destroy all dimensions and fuse the Digital and human worlds into one. As the destruction unfolds, Taiki and Mervamon fall through the collapsing ground and vanish! What will come of Taiki, and of the Digimon and human worlds?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 迫りくる! 人間界の最期の日, D5!!
Loom! The Human World`s Final Day, D5!!
Semarikuru! Ningenkai no Saigo no Hi, D5!!
episode.summary: As Bagramon proceeds with the Day of Ultimate Destruction, Taiki and Mervamon find themselves trapped under the Great Bagra Palace. There they discover Yuu, but a new enemy stands in their way when they attempt to save him. Meanwhile Kiriha watches as DarkKnightmon forcibly fuses with Bagramon, creating an immensely powerful DigiXros that destroys whole realms and all the data in them. Is it too late for Taiki`s team to stop D5?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 栄光のデジクロス, つかめ! おれたちの未来!!
Glorious DigiXros, Seized for Our Future!!
Eikou no DigiXros, Tsukame! Oretachi no Mirai!!
episode.summary: The true DarknessBagramon has completely frozen the human world. In the middle of it all, Taiki is reunited with Examon, WarGreymon, and the Digimon who led him to the Digital World, Omegamon. With the help of all 15 of the knights in their order, he formulates a plan, but carrying it out would throw him into extreme danger alone. Can Taiki defeat DarknessBagramon and save the future of his own world?! Source: crunchyroll
